summary: This document is a series of internal FBI emails from September 2019 coordinating victim briefings for the Epstein case in New York and Miami. It discusses tracking victim lists, sending invitation letters, and logistical details for the meetings. The emails reveal the FBI's Victim Services Division's efforts to inform victims about available services.

persons.name: Elton, Pamela S.
persons.context: FBI employee copied on an email regarding the coordination of Epstein case victim briefings.

persons.name: Sosa, Cinthia J.
persons.context: FBI Victim Specialist in Miami (MM) who had previously reserved a conference room for the Epstein briefing.

events.title: Epstein Victim Briefing - Florida
events.description: A victim briefing meeting scheduled to be held in Miramar, Florida, for victims of the Epstein case to learn about available victim services.

events.title: Epstein Victim Briefing - New York
events.description: A victim briefing meeting scheduled to be held in New York, NY, for victims of the Epstein case to learn about available victim services.

events.title: RSVP Deadline for Victim Briefings
events.description: The deadline for victims to respond if they wish to attend the scheduled briefings in Florida or New York.

keyFacts: The FBI Victim Services Division was organizing briefings for Epstein case victims in October 2019 in both New York and Florida.
The New York case (31E-NY-3027571) involved 39 victims, while the Miami case (31E-MM-108062) involved 35 victims, indicating separate victim lists for the two jurisdictions.
Internal coordination involved tracking victim contact information, invitation responses, and logistical details like conference room reservations.
The briefings were intended to inform victims of available services but would not provide specific details about the active investigation.
The email chain shows systematic FBI follow-up with victims after Epstein's arrest and death.
